scheme_name: Maulana Azad Education Finance Foundation Scheme
brief_description: "Maulana Azad Education Finance Foundation Scheme" is a social security scheme by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides interest-free loans for higher education and overseas studies to the minority students.
detailed_description: "Maulana Azad Education Finance Foundation Scheme" is a social security scheme by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide interest-free loans for higher education and overseas studies to the minority students.
benefits: Interest-free loans of up to ₹5,00,000/- for pursuing higher education and studies abroad
Note: The beneficiary will have to repay the loan in the next 3 years after completing 6 months of education/ service.
eligibility_criteria: Beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. Beneficiary should belong to the minority community. The age of the beneficiary should be between 18-35 years of age. Beneficiary should have passed Higher Secondary (12th Class). The University/College/Institution, where the student is studying/ enrolled, should be recognized by the Central/ State Government or any other competent authority. The income of the beneficiary's family from all sources should not exceed ₹2,50,000/-.

steps: Step 1: Applicants should visit their nearest District Office or office of the Minorities Welfare Officer and collect application form. Step 2: Fill the form properly and attach all the documents (attested,if required). Step 3: Submit the form latest by 31st August of the concerned year at the District Office or the office of the Minorities Welfare Officer.

documents_required:
For the Applicant:
Colour Photograph, Aadhaar Card, Permanent Residence Certificate, Minority Proof Certificate, Proof of Birth. Marksheet of last year, College/Institution Admission Certificate, Fee structure, College ID, Nationalised Bank Passbook, Affidavit to the effect that the loan scheme is being availed of for the first time.
For the 2(two) Guarantors:
Salary/Income Certificate, PAN card, Photographs, Aadhaar Card, Ration Card, Status Certificate Report.
